briefdescription.para: The number of objectives in the optimization problem.
The number of decision variables in the optimization problem. This number includes the decision variables for the infrastructure and the decision variables for the utilities.
The default directory where input data files are stored.
The default directory where output files are stored. This folder will always be created if it doesn't exist.
The default directory where the ROF tables are stored. This folder will always be created if it doesn't exist.
The default directory where the input DU factor timeseries are. By default, WaterPaths assumes that all DU factor files are located in the same directory as the WaterPaths executable.
Peaking factor used to move from daily capacity to average weekly capacity.
Demand peaking factor used to scale the Joint WTP treatment re-allocation calculation.
The number of weeks in a year.
The number of weeks in a year rounded to the nearest integer.
The number of months in a year.
The number of weeks in a month.
The number of weeks used to calculate the short-term ROF.
The number of weeks used to calculate the long-term ROF.
The default starting value of the short-term ROF.
The default starting value of the long-term ROF.
The number of realizations used to calculate the ROF for insurance pricing. FIXME: Need to clarify this.
The number of realizations used to calculate ROFs in general.
The treatment capacity of a small WTP in MGD. FIXME: Need to clarify this.
The treatment capacity of a large WTP in MGD. FIXME: Need to clarify this.
The storage-to-capacity ratio below which the system is considered to have failed.

The treatment-to-capacity ratio below which the system is considered to have failed. Based on this PDF here by the North Carolina Office of Administrative Hearings <http://reports.oah.state.nc.us/ncac/title%2015a%20-%20environmental%20quality/chapter%2002%20-%20environmental%20management/subchapter%20t/15a%20ncac%2002t%20.0118.pdf>
A flag to indicate that a water source has not been allocated to a utility.
The maximum number of utilities that can be considered in the model. FIXME: Could be expanded.
The maximum fraction of contingency fund to revenue after which insurance is purchased.
A boolean flag to indicate whether the demand buffer is applied.
A boolean flag to indicate whether the demand projection is applied.
A boolean flag to indicate whether the demand is reprojected.
The number of years to look ahead for demand projection.
The number of years to look back for demand reprojection.
The frequency of demand reprojection in years.
The proportion of the utility's capacity that is considered as a floor after which it can no longer supply water. FIXME: Need to clarify this.
The initial value of the massive value used in the model. FIXME: Need to clarify this.
A boolean flag indicating whether the model should use pre-calculated ROF tables.
A boolean flag indicating if the model should NOT use pre-calculated ROF tables.
A flag indicating that the model should export ROF tables.
A flag indicating that the model should not import nor export ROF tables.
A flag indicating that the model should import ROF tables.
The baseline storage capacity multiplier FIXME: Need to clarify this.
A boolean flag indicating that a water source is online.
A boolean flag indicating that a water source is offline.
A flag indicating that a utility is in a state of failure.
A flag indicating that a utility is not in a state of failure.
The default NONE value.
A flag indicating that an object has not yet been initialized.
The default ID of a utility.
The ID of the fixed flow controls MinEnvFlow object.
The ID of the inflow controls MinEnvFlow object.
The ID of the seasonal controls MinEnvFlow object.
The ID of the storage controls MinEnvFlow object.
The ID of the Jordan Lake controls MinEnvFlow object.
The ID of the Falls Lake controls MinEnvFlow object.
The ID of the level debt service Bond object.
The ID of the balloon payment Bond object.
The ID of the floating interest Bond object.
The ID of the variable interest Bond object.
A boolean flag indicating if a bond began its repayment at issuance.
The default column with for printing table (.tab) files.
The default precision for printing table (.tab) files.
The default worst-case cost percentile. FIXME: Should be renamed to WORST_CASE_COST_PERCENTILE.
The default unit cost percentile.
The default storage curve threshold above which insurance is purchased. FIXME: Need to clarify this.
The number of insurance storage tiers as a function of the storage curve threshold. FIXME: Need to clarify this.
A flag to identify if a water source has a water quality allocation.
The number of a specific week of a year across all years in the simulation model up to week 4017.
This class is defined in a header-only file that contains the default value of the constants used throughout the model. Update this file to change the default values of the constants.
